Package saveAndLoad

Class LoadMatch

java.lang.Object
saveAndLoad.LoadMatch
All Implemented Interfaces:
LoadInterface
public class LoadMatch
extends java.lang.Object
implements LoadInterface
Class LoadMatch is the class supposed to give methods for loading a match from a file. Obviously, this file must have an internal specific pattern (that is, the pattern in which it is saved, in the SaveMatch class). If the file is provided in a different way, LoadMatch will raise an exception. In order to adhere to the Observer design pattern, this class must implement LoadInterface interface.
Author:
andre

  • Constructor Details

    • LoadMatch

      public LoadMatch()

  • Method Details

    • loadMatch

      public Match loadMatch​(java.lang.String fileName) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, CorruptedFileException
      This method takes as input a string, that is the file name, so that an object of type Scanner can access (and read from) it. In order to separate methods responsibilities, it has been created a method for determining each component of the match constructor, so we have loadPlayer to load a type Player object, loadTurn to retrieve the turn of the saved match and so on. If the method isTampered returns true (signifying that the file the scanner is reading is corrupted or not properly modified), throws a new CorruptedFileException to be handled in a calling class.
      Specified by:
      loadMatch in interface LoadInterface
      Parameters:
      fileName - is the name of the file from which load the match.
      Returns:
      an object of type Match, the match that is correctly rebuilt
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - when file trying to read is not found
      CorruptedFileException - when file trying to read is corrupted

    • loadPlayer

      private static Player loadPlayer​(java.io.File fileName, java.util.Scanner fileScanner, boolean isFirstPlayer)
      Method used to load the player from the given file, fileName. It uses a Scanner object, fileScanner, to scan the file and to find the statement "First player: " if the boolean parameter isFirstPlayer is set to true, or the statement "Second player: " in the case isFirstPlayer is set to false. It is assumed the file is in the format used to create it in the SaveMatch class, so the player part is in the form "First/Second player: playerName, token color: colorRedComponent colorGreenComponent colorBlueComponent" At the end, it is created the player object of type Player, that has the name read from file and the token color constructed from the color components read in the file too.
      Parameters:
      fileName - is the file.
      fileScanner - is the scanner that reads the file.
      isFirstPlayer - indicates if the player reading is the first or not.
      Returns:
      the player object loaded

    • loadTurn

      private static int loadTurn​(java.io.File fileName, java.util.Scanner fileScanner)
      Method used to load the turn from the given file, fileName. It uses a Scanner object, fileScanner, to scan the file. It is assumed the file is in the format used to create it in the SaveMatch class, so the turn part is in the form: "Turn: X" where X is a number At the end, it is returned the turn.
      Parameters:
      fileName - is the file.
      fileScanner - is the scanner that reads the file.
      Returns:
      the int turn.

    • countTokens

      private static int countTokens​(java.io.File fileName, java.util.Scanner fileScanner)
      Method for counting the number of token listed in the file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - is the file containing the saved match
      fileScanner - is the Scanner object.
      Returns:
      the number of token counted.

    • loadBoard

      private static Board loadBoard​(java.io.File fileName, java.util.Scanner fileScanner, Player firstPlayer, Player secondPlayer) throws CorruptedFileException
      Method used to load the board from the given file, fileName. It uses a Scanner object, fileScanner, to scan the file. It is assumed the file is in the format used to create it in the SaveMatch class, so the board part is in the form: "Board: Row: x Col: y tokenColorRedComp tokenColorGreenComp tokenColorBlueComp . . . " While there is another line in the file, it finds each value of the token color and inserts it into the Board, but only if it satisfy the wise checkIntegrity method. At the end, it is returned the gameBoard.
      Parameters:
      fileName - is the file.
      fileScanner - is the scanner that reads the file.
      firstPlayer - player number one of the match.
      secondPlayer - player number two of the match.
      Returns:
      the Board gameBoard.
      Throws:
      CorruptedFileException - when a file is corrupted or not integer as stated by the IntegrityMatrix.

    • isTampered

      private static boolean isTampered​(int turn, int numberOfTokens)
      The purpose of this method is to check if the file trying to read is tampered, that happens in a variety of cases, but this checks that the bound numberOfTurns = numberOfTokenInserted + 1 (+1 because the first turn is the turn 1 and when a player save the match, he can save it only at the beginning of his turn, so it must be that the number of turns passed are greater than the number of token inserted in the Board + 1). This check is not included in the IntegrityMatrix class because it is linked to the number of turns, information written in the saved file, so it is strictly a concern of this class.
      Parameters:
      turn - is the turn value
      numberOfTokens - is the number of tokens in the board
      Returns:
      true if the file was tampered, so if someone inserted one or more token without hand crafting a correct value for turn, false otherwise.
